title: [SOLVED] Macbook Air 13" early 2015 820-00165 No chime No display fan runs
message:
Hi, I have a MacBook air 13" that does not chime does not display any picture but the fan runs 100% the firmware reset function works as well when I press cmd+option+p+r it resets but no chime, I bought a new efi chip on ebay and it displays the same symptom. Can anyone share any advice on what it might be?

thanks,

- Mike

title: [SOLVED] Macbook Air 13" early 2015 820-00165 No chime No display fan runs
message:
How do you know PRAM reset is working? Put back original chip, those Ebay ones are probably a dump from another board and will give ME region problems.
Connect a USB mouse and see if it lights up.

title: [SOLVED] Macbook Air 13" early 2015 820-00165 No chime No display fan runs
message: I truly appreciate your response, I took the bottom cover off and press cmd+option+p+r and I noticed the fan turn off and on what it does when there is no chime. I put back the original chip and it does the same thing. It seems like the ebay chip has done something to the logicboard. The chime was present when i had the original efi chip in there once I put the ebay efi chip it displayed the no chime black screen issue. The mouse lights on then turns off every 10 seconds.

title: [SOLVED] Macbook Air 13" early 2015 820-00165 No chime No display fan runs
message:
What do you think the issues is?/////

thank you,

-Mike

title: [SOLVED] Macbook Air 13" early 2015 820-00165 No chime No display fan runs
message: So is there a chime now with the original chip back?

title: [SOLVED] Macbook Air 13" early 2015 820-00165 No chime No display fan runs
message: Good evening, there is no chime with the original efi chip back in the logicboard. I left solder flux on the logicboard, do you think that might've shorted something?

title: [SOLVED] Macbook Air 13" early 2015 820-00165 No chime No display fan runs
message:
You said "The chime was present when i had the original efi chip in there"
So what happened, was there a chime at some point? Flux does not short out anything unless it is the fake garbage from China.

title: [SOLVED] Macbook Air 13" early 2015 820-00165 No chime No display fan runs
message: Yes the chime was present when i had the original efi chip in there.

title: [SOLVED] Macbook Air 13" early 2015 820-00165 No chime No display fan runs
message: The flux I used is top quality from MG Chemicals

title: [SOLVED] Macbook Air 13" early 2015 820-00165 No chime No display fan runs
message: Well, then it should still chime once you put it back. Something got messed up, inspect all resistors near U6100, maybe missing or moved.

title: [SOLVED] Macbook Air 13" early 2015 820-00165 No chime No display fan runs
message: thank you for all of your help, I figured out the issue, it was the efi it was stuck in some hang up mode I used a jtag programmer to kick it out of this weird state. How do I mark this as solved?
